cot.content:
To solve the problem, Please think and reason step by step, then answer.
question:
who is the current director of the us mint
        
Generation Format:
Reasoning process:
Answer:

Reasoning process: To determine the current director of the U.S. Mint, I need to consider the most recent information available regarding appointments to this position. The U.S. Mint is a bureau of the Department of the Treasury, and its director is typically appointed by the President of the United States. I will check for any recent news articles or official announcements that might provide the name of the current director.

Answer: As of my last update, the current director of the U.S. Mint is Ventris C. Gibson, who was appointed in 2021. However, please verify this information with the latest sources, as leadership positions can change.

anchoring.content:
You are a cognitive scientist, to answer the following question:
who is the current director of the us mint
I will provide you with several retrieved passages:
Passages:
['David J. Ryder (born October 14, 1955) is the current Director of the United States Mint. He formerly was in the same position from 1992 to 1993.\n', "In 2018, The Mint Museum announced Todd A. Herman, PhD, former Executive Director at The Arkansas Arts Center, as the new President and CEO. Bruce LaRowe, former Executive Director of Children's Theatre of Charlotte, was the Interim CEO in June 21, 2017. He assumed the role after the departure of Dr. Kathleen V. Jameson's Presidency in 2017.\n", "When the position of director is vacant, the senior career (non-political) official of the mint serves as the acting director/deputy director. Until the appointment of Mr. Ryder as director, the mint had been without an official director since the resignation of Edmund C. Moy in 2011. Richard A. Peterson succeeded Mr. Moy and was the longest-serving acting director/deputy director in the mint's history. Mr. Peterson served between January 2011 and March 2017. \n", "In July 2015 Matthew Rhett Jeppson was nominated by President Barack Obama to become the mint's 39th director and was given the temporary title of principal deputy director. However, the nomination was never confirmed by the Senate. Mr. Jeppson stepped down as principal deputy director in January 2017, being replaced by Acting Principal Deputy Director David Motl.\n", 'Director of the United States Mint\n', 'The Director of the United States Mint is a presidential appointment needing Senate confirmation. David J. Ryder became director in April 2018. He previously served as director from 1992 to 1993. \n', 'Section::::Director of U.S. Mint.\n', 'BULLET::::- Director of the Mint (five-year term of office)\n', 'Section::::Director of the United States Mint.\n', 'Section::::Director of the United States Mint.\n']

question_info.question: who is the current director of the us mint
passages:
David J. Ryder (born October 14, 1955) is the current Director of the United States Mint. He formerly was in the same position from 1992 to 1993.
In 2018, The Mint Museum announced Todd A. Herman, PhD, former Executive Director at The Arkansas Arts Center, as the new President and CEO. Bruce LaRowe, former Executive Director of Children's Theatre of Charlotte, was the Interim CEO in June 21, 2017. He assumed the role after the departure of Dr. Kathleen V. Jameson's Presidency in 2017.
When the position of director is vacant, the senior career (non-political) official of the mint serves as the acting director/deputy director. Until the appointment of Mr. Ryder as director, the mint had been without an official director since the resignation of Edmund C. Moy in 2011. Richard A. Peterson succeeded Mr. Moy and was the longest-serving acting director/deputy director in the mint's history. Mr. Peterson served between January 2011 and March 2017. 
In July 2015 Matthew Rhett Jeppson was nominated by President Barack Obama to become the mint's 39th director and was given the temporary title of principal deputy director. However, the nomination was never confirmed by the Senate. Mr. Jeppson stepped down as principal deputy director in January 2017, being replaced by Acting Principal Deputy Director David Motl.
Director of the United States Mint
The Director of the United States Mint is a presidential appointment needing Senate confirmation. David J. Ryder became director in April 2018. He previously served as director from 1992 to 1993.
